newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain calls for NATO focus to turn to Mediterranean.
newsitem.headline: Spain calls for NATO focus to turn to Mediterranean.

text.p: Spain said on Wednesday NATO should shift its focus in Europe toward the Mediterranean after spending so many Cold War years looking east.
Defence Minister Eduardo Serra called the Mediterranean a "true strategic area" and said southern Europe had the right to demand attention from its NATO allies.
"We need to turn our eyes to the south after looking eastward for the past 50 years," Serra said at a conference in Madrid sponsored by the International Herald Tribune newspaper.
Diplomats in Madrid say that Washington believes Spain would serve as a key staging ground for any conflict in Africa or the Middle East.
Serra said Spain wanted a greater presence in NATO command structures following parliament's decision earlier this month to join the alliance's military structure.

NATO officials are expected to recommend soon the creation of a new sub-regional command for Iberia on Spanish territory, answering one of Madrid's central demands in negotiations on full integration into the alliance's military command.
NATO currently has three regional commands in Europe - in Britain, the Netherlands and Italy - and sub-regional commands scattered across the continent.
